column4: Hello again... I need help with two primary problems in with 9.10
My first is my keyboard map I can't seem to locate my hash buttonn and I've typed everything ( I think)
I've got it set to a mac UK keyboard, which is what I have
I'm having to copy and paste the # symbol to access this channel
I was assuming the right and left alt both perform the same function
Ok, second problem; Does anyone have a dual screen setup and have problems with the monitor setup?
my nvidia dual screen setup works grreat
im using 2 LCD's both are DVI. i just use the nvidia settings tool with no hassles.. so cant really suggest much else to try
did you have to edit the nVidia config file?
all i did was use the nvidia-settings tool a few clicks and i got twinview going on 2 monitors..

I have twin view going just not perfect at the moment. I'm either getting the display spanned across the two screens (so my BG picture is stretched across both screens) in 75Hz mode or I'm getting access to only 2/3rds of the screen at 60Hz mode. Attempts to access the nVidia config tool says I need to run it Xconfig server as root which I don't know how to so far
the background wallpaper image is  a gnome issue. KDE for example does  the wallpaper correctly. You can even have a different wqllpaper on each monitor.
gksudo nvidia-settings   is the command to use
it's not just the wallpaper. Attempting to drag an application onto the other screen results in a limit, only 2/3rds of screen 2 can be accessed
sounds quirky. Ive never had such issues. Try the nvidia settings tool i guess and rearange the monitors.
I'm trying all I get is window with tick boxes, doesn't give me any other options tells me to run the nvidia-xconfig as root to change some options. gksudo-ing that file results in warnings only
